name: D. Dima and Lisa
statement:
Dima loves representing an odd number as the sum of multiple primes, and
Lisa loves it when there are at most three primes. Help them to
represent the given number as the sum of at most than three primes.More
formally, you are given an numer . Find a set of numbers (), such that
is a prime The numbers do not necessarily have to be distinct. It is
guaranteed that at least one possible solution exists.
editorial:
There is a fact that the distance between adjacent prime numbers isnât
big. For maximal distanse is . So letâs find maximal prime , such that
(we can just decrease n while itâs not prime(we can check it in )). We
know that . Now we have even (because and are odd) number and we should
divide it into a sum of two primes. As , we can just iterate over small
primes and check if is prime and is prime. You can check that there is a
solution for all even numbers less than by bruteforce.
